865101511:
[

Customer Service Advisor - West Region

Company Name Bank of Melbourne Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 67 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • West Region
  • Multiple Full time and Part Time 30hrs. pw positions
  • Retail Banking/ Sales and Customer Service
  • Require strong Sales and Service background
Bank of Melbourne isn't just another bank. Our Head Office and Customer Contact Centre are in the heart of Melbourne.

Our branches and corporate banking centres are staffed by the best and brightest people who will take an active role in their neighbourhood, because we believe that no one understands Victorians like the people who live here.

Our Opportunity - Customer Service Advisor

At Bank of Melbourne, we believe in taking the time to get to know our customers as a person, not a series of accounts. We're looking for people who genuinely enjoy dealing with people to be key members of our local branch customer service team.

Our Customer Service Advisors’ have a unique ability; they know how to make banking more of a conversation so customers actually look forward to coming into the branch. They know our customers' names and the neighbourhood they work in like the back of their hand, so they're always assured of a friendly face. Understanding the individual needs of both our personal and business owner customers is second nature and they're able to recommend exactly which products and services will genuinely serve them best. If more specialised advice is needed, they'll introduce customers to the local specialist best able to help.

What We Are Looking For From You

For a start, you'll love where you live and work, and enjoy creating a true sense of neighbourhood. You're at ease talking to people and know how to balance friendliness with a strong service ethic through your previous experience in sales and service. Working as part of a team is something you enjoy and you actively work with your team members to achieve performance goals. Problem-solving poses no problems, nor does thinking on your feet and adapting to change with ease.

Why this role is for you

Firstly, you want different, not traditional. You love the challenge of working in a dynamic environment where you're setting a new benchmark in customer service.

Secondly you crave development – because our customer service specialists are so critical to us there are so many opportunities for career & personal development available to them. Whether it is home lending, leadership, business banking or wealth – we have many opportunities for our people & we really want to see you grow.

Finally, you want to work with great people. You know that great people make great workplaces – we think we’ve developed a fantastic team of people and we want other fantastic people to join us.

Our commitment to you

Better banking can't be delivered without the right people. We understand that your satisfaction in what you do leads to our customers' satisfaction. We'll support and actively encourage your career development and growth, provide flexible work options and a host of some of the best financial & non-financial benefits out there.

Bank of Melbourne, as part of Westpac Group is an equal opportunity employer. As part of our commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, this role is open to experienced candidates seeking a discussion around workplace flexibility.

Where to from here?

Please apply online where you will find you will be invited to participate in the first part of our online process through our assessment partner Gallup, please action this request as early as possible, to enable us to manage your application and provide you with an update on your job application in a timely manner.

For more information visit CareersatBankofMelbourne

[

PMO Program Manager - Onshore Wind

Company Name Phillip Riley : Renewable Energy Recruitment, Consulting & Contracting Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 3 days ago Number of views 101 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Phillip Riley are pleased to invite applications from ambitious Renewable Energy Project Directors, Senior Project Managers with extensive experience delivering large, complex wind projects from last stage development, through construction and into O&M.

We are currently working with a global leader in the renewable energy marketplace, with an large portfolio of wind projects across Australia and NZ. As a key player in the organisation, you will lead the construction and contracts management across the renewable projects portfolio. This is an amazing opportunity to join a great team, with considerable growth opportunities, who are passionate about helping to move Australia to a low carbon future.

As the Project Director, you will lead multiple Wind Farm construction projects, including EPC negotiations and contractor management, while also assessing commercial risks. Leading projects from construction to operations you will set the communications strategy, both internally and externally. Critical to your success in the position will be your highly developed communication skills and ability to work with a variety of stakeholders. Applicants should have extensive experience leading previous Wind Farm constructions, will have lead a Wind project from Development to Operations, have highly developed stakeholder management skills and will have demonstrated experience leading EPC negotiations and structuring commercial contracts. You will also lead the compliance and risk management functions over this portfolio of wind projects.

This really is a fantastic opportunity for an experienced Senior Project Manager or Project Director, to make a move to an established leader in the renewables industry. On offer to the successful candidate, is an above market salary package, flexible working arrangements and a great group of people to work with, that makes going to work enjoyable.

Our clients is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, and veteran or disability status.

To register your interest in this position, please apply online quoting reference 2807348 or for a confidential discussion about your career, please contact Jeremey Hale on +61(0)3 9192 9925.

Please note that all candidates must have the right to work in Australia and be current citizens to apply.

Phillip Riley is a boutique Renewable Energy Recruitment business providing job, career and consulting services across the Asia Pacific industry & are happy to receive expressions of interest from experienced leaders and future leaders in the sector.
\xa0
The Future Is Renewable www.phillipriley.com.au

New Posted Date Posted 21 hours ago Number of views 28 views

Job description

Benefits include-

  • Enjoy a busy and varied business support role supporting a Compliance Local Laws team
  • Potential for extension and ongoing work
  • Flexible work arrangements available - part-time or full-time options
  • Free secure onsite parking or excellent transport links close to council
  • ASAP start - apply today, start tomorrow!
About the role-

Design & Build are currently seeking an experienced Business Support Officer to join the a Council in Melbourne south-east working within Local Laws, Health & Building on an initial 8 week contract with the potential to extend to on-going upon completion.

Working across multiple teams you are guaranteed variety in your role providing quality, timely, accurate and efficient administration support to the department.

Key duties-

  • Ensure applications received by the Community Safety & Building Department are processed in accordance with legislative requirements in an accurate and timely manner
  • Prepare and issue various permits and ensure relevant registers are updated and maintained
  • Maintain accurate records of infringements in accordance with relevant legislation and submit infringement data to the Infringements Court within statutory timeframes
  • Process payments for registrations, infringements, permits and applications ensuring they are accurately receipted according to procedures
  • Draft responses to correspondence in accordance with Council’s policies, standards and guidelines
  • Develop strong and positive relationships with both internal and external customers
Requirements include-

  • Previous experience in a similar role
  • Immediate availability
  • Experience in the use of system PATHWAY or similar
For a confidential discussion regarding this opportunity or other Project Management roles in Local Government, please contact Sarah Kettlewell on (03) 8535 3100

Job description

Responsibilities

The Service Support Specialist will:
  • Administer and execute internal processes and those involving external third-parties – including;
    • Call, email and activity logging for Technical Support and field teams.
    • Case and task logging to support field activities like relocations, validation services and equipment maintenance.
    • Tools forecasting, ordering, tracking and calibration coordination.
    • Spare parts availability, ordering and tracking.
  • Run and deliver routine and ad-hoc analytics for critical service operations, process compliance, customer engagement as well as tools and spare parts monitoring.
  • Contribute to the creation and quality of service-owned SFDC and SAP data fields, and the creation and maintenance of documentation using our Asset Management system (Seismic)
  • Collaborate with Field Management, Customer Service, Global Logistics, global analysts and information systems (GIS) staff to ensure compliant, successful, aligned execution.

Requirements
  • 3+ years in a field service, customer support or logistics environment – Life Sciences, scientific instruments or related industry preferred
  • Experience working with CRM and ERP software and associated data maintenance and reporting - SFDC & SAP would be highly regarded
  • Able to multi-task and work independently to provide world-class support to diverse stakeholders.
  • Strong analytical skills and attention to detail
  • Excellent verbal and written communication in English, with strong interpersonal skills developed in an international, small-team environment
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office programs, especially Excel, but also Outlook, PowerPoint etc.
  • Nice to have:
    • Japanese or Korean language capability
    • Reporting and collaboration systems exposure – Tableau, Quip
All listed tasks and responsibilities are deemed as essential functions to this position; however, business conditions may require reasonable accommodations for additional tasks and responsibilities.

Preferred Educational Background
  • Bachelor’s degree with some science, preferably biology

Developer/Snr Developer

Company Name Vicinity Centres Company Location Chadstone, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 3 days ago Number of views 42 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

We exist to enrich community experiences. We reimagine destinations of the future, creating places where people love to connect. We do this by creating unique and relevant consumer experiences, delivering compelling value to our retail partners and striving for excellence in everything we do.


Role purpose

As a Developer, you will collaborate with others to create awesome business outcomes for Vicinity Centres, our Consumers and our Retailers from project inception through to delivery, by ensuring that product software deliverables meet the specifications and requirements as defined, and are produced on schedule to the highest quality standards.


What will you bring? \xa0 \xa0 \xa0\xa0

\xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0

You will be an experienced Developer with a background in agile, large scale commercial, continuous delivery environments. You will have knowledge of and experience in software development languages and tools such as Javacscript, React, Node.js, Buildkite, Object Oriented Design, and SQL combined with experience deploying cloud based solutions to AWS and/or Azure utilising best practice for scalability, resilience, and recovery.


You will be analytical with a can do attitude and the ability to manage concurrent projects. You will also contribute to creating a great team culture by role modelling a collaborative approach to working with team members, offering leadership, encouragement, mentoring and guidance, particularly to more junior Developers.


What will success look like? \xa0 \xa0\xa0

\xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0

We Imagine a Better Way

  • You confidently apply your technical expertise and are relentless in your pursuit to make things better, easier and more enjoyable
  • You probe, explore, improve and repeat to consistently do things better and help bring the Vicinity brand to life
  • You are confident in speaking up and can recommend new ways of working or business solutions to meet the needs of stakeholders


We Embrace Difference

  • You proactively embrace and encourage diverse views and display a growth mindset in everything you do
  • You use a diverse viewpoint to influence decisions across key business stakeholders
  • You recognise others skills and expertise and embrace the opportunity to work with cross-functional teams.


We Always Collaborate

  • You effectively collaborate and connect people and teams across the business to create solutions.
  • You proactively and consistently share information across the broader development team and key stakeholders and communicate in a clear concise and appropriate manner.
  • You actively consult, engage and listen to all team members and make sound decisions in a transparent manner.


Why Vicinity?

At Vicinity, we are in the business of people. The people who shop in our centres, lease our retail space, invest in our centres, and of course, the people who work in and for our centres and our corporate office. Our people are important, and we believe in giving them every opportunity to grow and succeed in our business.

Our benefits program focuses on creating an awesome place to work in which our people are rewarded and recognised, and offers flexibility, balance and continuous learning opportunities, ensuring we give back, and that we look after ourselves.


Our values cultivate a culture that encourages our 1300+ team members to be curious, agile, passionate and committed. At Vicinity we embrace difference. We are committed to creating an inclusive work environment that supports diversity and flexibility.


Note: To be eligible to apply for this position, you must have existing, relevant Australian work rights. At the later stages of the recruitment process the shortlisted candidate/candidates will be required to undergo a Criminal History Background/Police Check as a mandatory part of the process. Additional qualification checks may also be required dependant on role and level.

Solution Architect (AWS)
Melbourne
$140-150,000 Package.

About Us

We know what we do best and stick to that! That’s what our customers want, experts in Cloud and DevOps.
Through our team of certified and experienced Cloud experts, we provide Cloud consulting, technical delivery and proactive management, monitoring and support services – making complex technology easy to use for any organisation, giving our customers the freedom to be remarkable.
Our Cloud services extend across the entire technology stack from key Cloud infrastructure platforms: AWS, VMWare Hosting and Hybrid Cloud; to Enterprise Integration/APIs, DevOps & Agile implementation; to application development; and Cloud optimisation and installation of market leading applications such as Trend Micro, Magento, Squixa, Sitecore, Hybris, New Relic, SAP and more.
We’re a team of experienced and friendly individuals, all dedicated to helping organisations make Cloud work. We are passionate about leading the market by living our values, values that have been instilled in our culture since the day the doors opened for business.

About The Role

You will be working as an integral part of the Bulletproof team, this role’s primary purpose is to attend meetings, whilst supporting our sales team in a senior pre-sales capacity. You will be engaging with some of Bulletproof's most rapidly developing customers enabling them to disrupt their chosen market. You will be working on AWS solutions and delivering to our customers.

Area of Responsibility
  • Solve customer pain points by leveraging the latest infrastructure architectural patterns to quickly deliver value to customers.
  • Create technical documentation relevant to sales, provisioning and cloud support areas of the business, for example: tender/RFP responses, technical designs, cost calculators
  • Develop template collateral and service catalogue items for provisioning tasks
  • Create and maintain internal operating procedures, Salesforce documentation, customer design documentation in Wiki, etc.

    • Skills Required

  • Ability to meet face to face and communicate effectively with Bulletproof customers
  • AWS Certification(s)
  • Skills in CloudFormation
  • Strong Automation skills
  • Must be hands on with delivery

    • Desirable Skills

  • Azure
